intro: Lucuma hartii, commonly known as the golden fruit or lucuma, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to the Andean regions of South America, particularly Peru and Ecuador. The plant produces large, yellow-orange fruits that are rich in nutrients and have a sweet, nutty flavor. Its fruit is often used in culinary applications, including desserts and beverages. The plant thrives in high-altitude environments with cool temperatures and well-drained soil.
